definition: fire/urgent/ammunition/fiery or flaming/internal heat (Chinese medicine)/hot (popular)/classifier for military units (old)/Kangxi radical 86

sentences.english: A fire burns in the cauldron, as a reminder of the Olympic flame.
sentences.chinese: 火炬塔裏燃燒着一團火焰，讓人想到奧林匹克聖火。

sentences.english: The torch will travel the length of Britain during its 70-day relay.
sentences.chinese: 火炬傳遞將在英國國內進行，持續70天。

sentences.english: This torch is then carried by a relay of runners to the site of the Summer or Winter games.
sentences.chinese: 之後這支火炬由跑者接力送至夏季或冬季比賽地點。

sentences.english: With the countless torches lit, with the silent sea of faces and the unbarred heads.
sentences.chinese: 無數火炬燃起，無數臉孔和致哀者彙集的沉默海洋。

sentences.english: During that project, the new torch was carefully covered with thin sheets of 24k gold.
sentences.chinese: 在修復工程中，新的火炬由24K純金薄片仔細覆蓋。

sentences.english: Qomolangma started with Gyigyi as the first bearer and Wang Yongfeng the second.
sentences.chinese: 此後，王勇峯隊長擔任第二棒火炬手。

sentences.english: Re- ignited the torch of life.
The first flame torcher Liu Xiang ran over Tian'an men Square during domestic torch relay for Beijing Olympic.
sentences.chinese: 北京奧運會境內第一棒火炬手劉翔跑過天安門廣場。

sentences.english: The torch arrived at the Guangzhou airport on Tuesday before dark.
sentences.chinese: 星期二天黑前，火炬抵達廣州白雲機場。

sentences.english: Studies have shown that the white pine and loblolly pine are 2 kinds of trees that grow well on marginal land.
sentences.chinese: 研究顯示，白松和火炬松在邊際土地上生長良好。

sentences.english: The team was burned out and we decided that it was time to find someone else to carry the torch.
sentences.chinese: 整個團隊已身心俱疲，我們覺得該把火炬傳給旁人了。

sentences.english: Romeo: Give me a torch, I am not for this ambling .
sentences.chinese: 給我一個火炬，我不高興跳舞。

sentences.english: What's the feeling to be a torchbearer ?
sentences.chinese: 作爲火炬手，你如何表達自己的心情？

sentences.english: We went to the torchbearers themselves, and overwhelmingly they said they supported the change.
sentences.chinese: 我們問了火炬傳遞團隊，他們說支持走另外一條路。

sentences.english: But the torch had been burning for one whole year, and yet nobody came.
sentences.chinese: 但是，火炬燃燒了整整一年，也沒有人前來求見。

sentences.english: The final torch bearer was former cross country skier Stefania Belmondo of Italy.
sentences.chinese: 最後一位持火炬者是意大利前滑冰冠軍貝爾蒙多。

definition: tinder/source of a fire/inflammable material/(fig.) spark (of a revolution etc)
spark/meteor trail (mostly used in expressions like 急如星火[ji2 ru2 xing1 huo3])
to stop burning/to go out (of fire)/to die out/extinguished
relay baton/(fig.) responsibilities (passed over to one's successor)
to ignite/to light/fig. to spark off (hopes, controversy, flames of revolution)
a single spark (idiom); an insignificant cause can have a massive effect
